title: New client - runs like a dog on older machines
body: My machine handles it fine but was playing on a relo's PC over the break and man the new client was a bit of a beeiiiaaatch to use.

replies.body: Have you tried turning on "Low Spec Mode" and "Disable Animations" on that machine? I know I forget about those options just cause my PC at home runs everything on super duper ultra settings just fine.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=IPErpKWq,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-04T02:43:41.853+0000)
>
> Have you tried turning on "Low Spec Mode" and "Disable Animations" on that machine? I know I forget about those options just cause my PC at home runs everything on super duper ultra settings just fine.

I didnt bother tbh - just ran it through the legacy client.

Eh I mean whatever works. But obviously Legacy won't always be an option. 

Most modern built PCs (even budget ones) won't even blink at the new fanciness, but obviously some people are limited to older laptops/PCs that just don't handle it very well, hence the options.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=IPErpKWq,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-04T03:45:57.138+0000)
>
> Eh I mean whatever works. But obviously Legacy won't always be an option. 
> 
> Most modern built PCs (even budget ones) won't even blink at the new fanciness, but obviously some people are limited to older laptops/PCs that just don't handle it very well, hence the options.

I'm still running the legacy client on my new machine too - I like the interface more particulary when it comes to inviting people to games from clubs and chats, and seeing recently played etc.

The recently played is definitely something I want to see in the new client, as is item sets (though not a high priority for me as it is for some others) and a GODDAMN HIDE MOBILE OPTION,  but generally speaking I like the new interface better. 

The way clubs are done is something I don't particularly like, since they are given high priority position on your friends list, but I never use them, so they're just taking up space that I feel should be filled by my "I always play with these people when they're on" friends group.

As for invites, I always just right-click and add from friends list anyway and that hasn't changed for me at all. Like I said I don't use clubs at all (or chats for that matter), and for everything else I defs prefer the new client.
